comments.value: Notes on SLA documentation.

Festival going down today. We knew it wasn't our problem within 5 mins, but Kieran had to stay on call for 2 hours. This is not acceptable.

The problem was due to some of Akamai's edge servers in london not routing to origin servers properly. It was a wider BT routing issue (on a public BT router).

We probably need to set up scripts that can check for this automatically, that Locog can use before they call us in future.

Task: summarize and estimate the cost of doing this. contact Russ.

http://www.london2012.com/sustainability

Hi Michael,

I have increased it to 14 documents, I hope that is ok.

But we probably should go much higher than that, if you have more documents then it might be better to separate them out onto a new page (possibly a dedicated list template, better suited to listing lots of documents or even a link to a "canned search" of the relevant publications via the publications search page). The reason I say that is because that template "Generic content" is probably the most used template on the site and by increasing it in this situation we will be increasing it everywhere else it is used (we can say allow 6 slots in normal usage and 12 slot everywhere else, unless we create a new template).

Jamie

Danny, there's an issue with searches on the Festival site and as a
result need to make 2 updates to the query sent to GDP:

1. Add parameter '&searchInDescription=true'
2. Add Â parameter '&sortedBy=SCORE'

The first one is new and will be in an updated API this coming Monday
(Feb 27). The second is defined in the current API docs and will order
the resultset by relevance, which is esp useful given the new expanded
search by description.

Note that the query with the two parameters only applies for
user-generated searches with a search-string, i.e. not when displaying
standard event lists e.g. by category.

Let me know if you have questions.

Thanks,
Wahome
Marking as high. Will look at this early next week.
Done.

Quick test on this doesn't seem to work: for example "world shakespeare"
ought to return at least as many events as "world shakespeare festival"

Hi Wahome,
I will double-check shortly, but have the GDP api changes definitely been
implemented?
And, incidentally, why would you expect more results for ws than for wsf?
Are you certain that the GDP search api ANDs the search terms (as opposed
to ORing them)?
Kieran

Just to let you know:

We are finally going live with the events upload form on Monday:   https://www.london2012.com/get-involved/whats-on/add-an-event.php

This has been live on the site for a while, so you don't need to do anything.

However, there is one issue: on stage 3 when you add a venue and submit, you get taken halfway down the next page - so you see only white. You have to scroll up in order to see the form elements.

I recall we had a problem like this with the eDialog form too. Was the fix implemented on our side, or does it have to be GDP who fix it?

Grateful for your thoughts!

Morag Reavley

Marking as high.

Also: this is urgent.

The iframe is not deep enough for Stage 4 â€“ cuts off at the bottom. See below. Can you review, please?

[cid:image001.png@01CCF85E.652BB800]
taking a look now...

Hi Morag,

I can't actually see the issue (although I am just firing up IE) 

But I think that problem you are describing is due to the use of an iFrame, on a normal webpage when you click 'next' the browser window will normally load the next page, pre-scrolled to the top (even if you were previously half way down the page). However when you use an iFrame, the iFrame itself is effectively the browser window, so that while the 'next' may load - pre scrolled to the top of the iFrame window - the page holding the IFrame will stay static.

I f that is the issue you are experiencing I think GDP need to add something similar to this (not necessarily exactly this, but this is along the right track) to their iFrame page.
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3805243/jquery-scroll-to-top-of-iframe-parent

So yes it is something that needs to be fixed at GDP's end, although the issue probably only presents itself when the page is displayed inside an iFrame (and step 2 is deeper than step 3)

Hope that makes sense, it's much easier to 'show' that describe in an email !!

Jamie

Actually what I suggested probaly won't work as the GDP page is on a different domain and a page loaded iFrame from a different domain isn't allowed to control the 'parent' window (for security reasons).

It's not ideal (especially at this late stage) but the solution is probably to change the design so that each step is of a similar size/height, ideally a size/height that is always visible in the iFrame (so that you dont' hit a situation where a user scrolls down to see the bottom of step 2 and then hits 'next' and has to scroll back up the page to see step 3).

Hi Morag,

Just realised that I didn't email you earlier to say we had extended the height of the iFrame

Jamie
Saw it! Thanks so much!

Hi Lars,

The category list I have is - 

â€¢	Construction & Venues

â€¢	Culture, Ceremonies & Torch Relay

Can we implement this, and then let me know if there is an issue around compatibility.

Hi Tom (+Danny and Lars)

We just need to add the new tags to the Theme taxonomy.
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/coder/_system/taxonomy/themes.xml

I was just about to do this but released (with the values below) that there is a question around whether we are in danger of mixing up navigation labels and tags ie. is "Culture, Ceremonies & Torch Relay" really a tag or a grouping of tags? I think we should be tagging articles to Culture, Ceremonies and/or Torch Relay and if we need to group them in the navigation then do that there. Is 'Round the UK' really a tag, or just a grouping for articles that don't fit into any of the above categories?

Just to clarify, tthe reason we are re-using the 'Theme' taxonomy is that, that is the taxonomy also used by other pages on the site including Photos, Videos etc. so if we want related images and videos to tie in with News and Blog pages it doent' make sense to have two taxonomies / tags (unless you want to also re-tag all the photos and videos)

The one danger / issue here is where we have News articles that are already tagged to the theme Taxonomy (as obv. we are not differentiating between the new tags and the existing ones).

In terms of tagging existing articles, you will need to re-tag News/Blog articles if you want a tag driven navigation, although you probably only need to tag up enough recent articles to fill the navigation (the older articles will still appear under month/year). 

Let me know your thoughts, as obviously it would be good to get this piece of work live.

Jamie

Jamie

Hi, I'm interested in hearing any opinions you have on my question, above.

  http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com/

I propose that this link appears if:
  you are browsing on a mobile device and you have requested to view the desktop site.
Without this link there is no (obvious) way to return to the mobile-optimized site.
Kieran

I am attaching this comment, while inviting Andy to join this thread.

Andy, a ramification of this ticket is that the current redirect behaviour for MOBILE user agents is changing as follows:

Currently: Any request for "index.php" is served a redirect to /mobile/. All other requests are served "as normal".

New behaviour: All requests are redirected to the associated MOBILE page (if it exists), else the "desktop" version is served.

I'm inviting you to this ticket in case you (or David) notice any changes to SEO behaviour, or in case you have any opinions on whether this will have any negative side-effects.

I intend to serve:
 301 Moved Permanently
accompanied by a "Vary: User-agent" header (which we don't currently serve; I am particularly interested in whether you feel we should serve this).

Please let me know if you have any questions. Soon, if possible, as this new behaviour is awaiting launch.

Thanks in advance,

Kieran
Kieran, shall I close this? Presumably the functionality is not still awaiting launch.

Hi Kieran,

Apols I didn't get to this ticket either. Tom tells me it's now been implemented and since we've not seen any SEO impact I would assume it's all ok.

Andy

This behaviour has NOT been launched/enabled yet.
As far as I'm, concerned, it's just a matter or "flicking the switch", but I did want to double-check that you weren't concerned about any SEO implications.
Similar functionality has been implemented on the /festival/ site, so it would be worth checking that there have been no SEO implications there before launching the behaviour on the www site.
Kieran
1.5 days development completed in November. Marking as solved in order to add the days to this month. Please feel free to re-open in order to get this functionality launched.
